wikipedia_page.main: George Chatterton (23 September 1821 – 1881) was an English first-class cricketer, active 1849–61, who played for Sheffield Cricket Club (aka Yorkshire) and Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC). A right-handed batsman and occasional right-arm slow underarm bowler, he scored 1,611 first-class runs with a highest score of 109, his only century, and took 25 wickets at 13.45, with his best return of 7 for 21 against Kent.

response: 33 first-class matches were recorded in 1851. The leading run-scorer was George Chatterton with 455 and the leading wicket-taker was James Grundy with 114.
